comments.body:
Looking at [the code](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/blob/v0.43.1/Libraries/CustomComponents/Lists/FlatList.js#L72), these are both _optional_ and _nullable_ (the leading question mark). So this should be:

```ts
ItemSeparatorComponent?: React.ComponentClass<any> | null
```

comments.body: This header isn't named the best. Adding yourself to this list means you want to be a maintainer and you will get notifications for each React Native related PR. Did you really intend to do that?
üò≥ sure. I want!

I have recently added @types/react-native-google-analytics-bridge, @types/react-navigation, @types/jpush-react-native and some improves on other types repo.
I hope that I can make my contribution to the TypeScript and Developers.
Awesome, thanks üôå
Btw, were you unable to use `React.StatelessComponent<any>`, as [suggested](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/issues/16820#issuecomment-304944375)?
Originally I thought you'd have to submit React.ReactElement<any> directly, but if you use FlatList this way, it crashes and expects either a ReactClass or a ()=> React.ReactElement
Ah gotcha, that makes sense üëç

comments.body: Can just use `TextStyle | TextStyle[]`

The flow type supports undefined values in the array, and that would work better for optionals where a given prop might be `ViewStyle?`. If you want to put that in an array, the array would need to support undefined values, right?
Can you give an example where undefined would appear in that array?

comments.body: This was an API added in RN 0.46 that doesn't exist in the DOM API.
These are the only two properties available on the RN "navigator" object.

There are still some issues with projects switching to pure ES2015-2017, such as the lack of type definitions for `XMLHttpRequest` and `fetch`. However, it can be done if the project uses its own declarations for those. These changes are to help get us on the path so that we can not require the DOM APIs for compiling projects.

I think this one already supported a function, because that‚Äôs what the `React.ComponentType` type is for. So I think you only need to change the `React.ComponentClass` instances below to use `React.ComponentType` as well.
oh, thank you. I'll try this method.

comments.body:
SectionList props extends VirtualizedSectionListProps:
[0.52-stable](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/blob/0.52-stable/Libraries/Lists/SectionList.js#L192)
[0.53-stable](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/blob/0.53-stable/Libraries/Lists/SectionList.js#L192)
[0.54-stable](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/blob/0.53-stable/Libraries/Lists/SectionList.js#L192)
[0.55-stable](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/blob/0.55-stable/Libraries/Lists/SectionList.js#L190)

@tn0502 Can you modify this line so we preserve `interface SectionListProperties<ItemT> extends VirtualizedListProperties<ItemT>`?
This modification seems okay as per [RN 0.52-stable](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/blob/0.52-stable/Libraries/Lists/SectionList.js#L38) and fixes the regression reported in issue #24031.

Just want to make sure that you understand that adding your name here means you‚Äôre signing up as maintainer and will get mentions on all future issues and PRs for the react-native typings. Is that what you intended?
